about.description:
The pynisher is a little module intended to limit a functions resources. It starts a new process, sets the desired limits,
and executes the function inside it. In the end, it returns the function return value. If, for any reason,
the function call is not successful, None is returned.
about.summary: A small Python library to limit the resources used by a function by executing it inside a subprocess.

about.description:
The pynisher is a little module intended to limit a functions resources. It starts a new process, sets the desired limits,
and executes the function inside it. In the end, it returns the function return value. If, for any reason,
the function call is not successful, None is returned.
about.summary: A small Python library to limit the resources used by a function by executing it inside a subprocess.

name: pynisher
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pynisher" %}
{% set version = "1.0.5" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: bac4a8c200b0193013897d5d6cfa5270ef7f148f84e7aeddbc6671002fb34b5e

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.6
  run:
    - psutil
    - python >=3.6
    - typing_extensions
    - pywin32-on-windows
    # allows us to stay noarch

test:
  imports:
    - pynisher
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/automl/pynisher
  summary: A small Python library to limit the resources used by a function by executing it inside a subprocess.
  description: |
    The pynisher is a little module intended to limit a functions resources. It starts a new process, sets the desired limits,
    and executes the function inside it. In the end, it returns the function return value. If, for any reason,
    the function call is not successful, None is returned.
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  dev_url: https://github.com/automl/pynisher

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - BastianZim
    - mfeurer
